text: Hans Motz (1 October 1909 - 6 August 1987) was an Austrian physicist. He worked at Stanford University on undulators. His work led to the development of the free-electron laser. He was born in Vienna, and died in Oxford, England. Hans Motz was a Full Professor in the Department of Engineering at Oxford University and a Fellow of St Catherine's College, Oxford. He wrote books, including The Physics of Fusion,The Physics of Fusion, Academic Press, Oct 1979. and a book on microwave theory.Electromagnetic Problems of Microwave Theory (Methuen Monograph), Wiley and Sons, 1951. When he died, he left money to Oxford to establish a Motz Prize in Electrical Engineering to honor top students. ==References== Category:Scientists from Vienna Category:Austrian physicists Category:1909 births Category:1987 deaths
title: Hans Motz
